intro: Trichera baldensis, commonly known as the Bald Mountain trichera, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected areas. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
